summary: This is a court order from the Southern District of New York authorizing attorneys and a paralegal to bring specific electronic devices (HP laptops) into the courthouse for use in the trial of United States vs. Ghislaine Maxwell. The authorization covers the period from November 29, 2021, to January 15, 2022, and is signed by a U.S. Judge.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the defendant in the criminal case United States vs. Ghislaine Maxwell, which is the proceeding for which the device authorization is granted.

persons.name: Sarah Drescher
persons.context: Identified as a paralegal with the U.S. Department of Justice who is authorized to bring an HP laptop into the courthouse for the Maxwell trial.

events.title: Authorized Device Use Period for Maxwell Trial
events.description: The period during which authorized attorneys and staff are permitted to bring specific electronic devices into the SDNY courthouse for use in the Ghislaine Maxwell trial proceedings.

locations: United States District Court, Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The document is a court order authorizing electronic devices for use in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal trial (S2 20 Cr. 330).
The authorization period spans from late November 2021 to mid-January 2022, indicating active trial proceedings during that time.
A paralegal named Sarah Drescher from the U.S. Department of Justice is specifically named as authorized to bring a device.
The order is signed by a U.S. Judge, indicating it is an official court directive.
The document references Standing Order M10-468, which governs the use of electronic devices in SDNY courthouses.
